content: I press c for compose-a-PM several times a day, I think (the correct incantation is C). Would it make sense to grant compose-a-PM p or some other lowercase letter?
It seems reasonable to give compose-PM a pretty "prime" hotkey. These are currently unused: abefhlmoptxyz
More thoughts? Going to change this to p, barring objections.
Hmm, I don't have any large problems with that
Hmm, this one I'm not so sure about. Doesn't p do something already (like narrow to your PMs)?
P does
(big P is taken, little p is available)
I guess another thought is whether it'd be better to do use z or x (aka the other things in the corner of the keyboard). p is kinda hard to reach.

I guess I'm pretty biased using dvorak, but I don't find shortcut placement to matter that much (with exceptions for things like j/k for up and down).
On the other hand I don't know how much mnemonics (like p for PM) matter either.

That being said I'd also be down for saving p for 'narrow to Private Messages', and then use x for compose PM.
I think that's reasonable to implement. We might want to keep C doing what it does to avoid causing confusion for people who use it often.

Just to clarify, which one do you think is best?
1. p for compose PM
2. x for compose PM
3. x for compose PM, p for narrow to PMs

I'm mildly against keeping C, in that I think now is a good time to make painful changes, and we might want to use C for something else in the future. Don't feel strongly though.
I think option 2 is what we want for now, reserving p for something related to reading PMs.
